alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 5:03PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Gadsden, central Liberty, central Leon, southeastern Decatur, southern Grady and southwestern Thomas Counties through 545 PM EST... At 503 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Cairo to 18 miles south of Greensboro. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Midway, Quincy, Tallahassee, Havana, Tallahassee Comm College, Doak Campbell Stadium, Florida State University, Lake Bradford, Florence, Jamieson, Rocky Hill, Iamonia, Calvary, Quincy Airport, Tallahassee Mall, Bloxham, Tallahassee Regional A/P, Lake Talquin, Levy Park and Andrew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for south central and southwestern Georgia.
